Description: THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE UNIVERSITY OF ALBANY (UALBANY) IN ITS EFFORTS TO ADVANCE WEATHER AND CLIMATE SCIENCE, ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY AND ENGINEERING, HOMELAND SECURITY, EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT, AND PUBLIC HEALTH PROTECTION.  UALBANY WILL HOST A WORKSHOP TO EXPLORE HOW UNIVERSITIES CAN STRENGTHEN COMMUNITY PREPAREDNESS, RESPONSE, AND RECOVERY TO EXTREME WEATHER EVENTS IN NEW YORK AND PUERTO RICO.  SPECIFICALLY, UALBANY WILL DEVELOP LOCALIZED VERSIONS OF THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S CLIMATE ADAPTION RESOURCE CENTER (ARC-X).  THE ARC-X IS AN ONLINE SYSTEM THAT BUILDS RESILIENCE OF COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE US TO EXTREME WEATHER EVENTS.

THIS PROJECT WILL PRODUCE A COMPREHENSIVE DATABASE OF THE INTRODUCTION AND SEASONAL USE OF ALL BOUTIQUE FUELS USED IN THE UNITED STATES SINCE 1990 COMBINED WITH AMBIENT AIR QUALITY MONITORING DATA TO DEVELOP STATISTICAL ESTIMATES OF BOUTIQUE FUEL SPECIFIC ESTIMATES OF AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS BY MONITOR.

THIS GRANT WILL HELP TO SUPPORT AERE CONFERENCES GATHERING RESEARCHERS, STUDENTS, AND POLICY PRACTITIONERS TO SHARE INFORMATION ON CUTTING EDGE ENVIRONMENTAL ECONOMICS RESEARCH ON POLLUTION AND ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY OPTIONS. THE CONFERENCES PROVIDE DISCUSSIONS ON CURRENT ISSUES AND STATE-OF-THE-ART RESEARCH METHODSAND IDENTIFY RESEARCH NEEDS FOR ADVANCING SOUND IDEAS AND NEW APPROACHESAND ENHANCE OPPORTUNITIES FOR COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS AMONG RESEARCHERS AND POLICY PRACTITIONERSAND AND ENCOURAGE SCHOLARSHIP, OFFERING YOUNG PROFESSIONALS FEEDBACK AND CONNECTIONS WITH THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY.

THIS RESEARCH PLANS TO ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICIENCY OF EXHAUST STANDARDS OVER THE LAST HALF CENTURY, INVESTIGATING HOW AIR POLLUTION FROM PASSENGER VEHICLES CHANGED OVER TIME, EXPLORING LONG-TERM CAUSES FOR DECLINES IN POLLUTION EMISSIONS FOR THE NEW AND USED US LIGHT DUTY VEHICLE FLEETS. THE RESEARCH WILL ALSO EXAMINE THE COST-EFFECTIVENESS OF THESE STANDARDS AND DEVELOP QUANTITATIVE MATHEMATICAL MODELS OF NEW AND USED VEHICLE FLEETS TO STUDY HOW FEASIBLE ALTERNATIVE POLICIES WOULD AFFECT VEHICLE POLLUTION EMISSIONS, CONSUMER CHOICES, AND CONSUMER WELL-BEING.

THIS RESEARCH WILL SUPPORT THE PROVISION OF DATA AND MODELS ON THE US FUEL REFINING INDUSTRY AS OPEN SOURCE (I.E., FREE TO THE PUBLIC) RESOURCES, INCLUDING A MODEL OF THE US REFINING INDUSTRY THAT CAN BE USED BY OTHER RESEARCHERS TO STUDY ECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS OF THIS INDUSTRY. THE MODEL PROVIDES AN IMPROVED TOOL TO INVESTIGATE IMPLICATIONS OF REGULATORY ALTERNATIVES FOR THE REFINING INDUSTRY MARKET STRUCTURE AND IMPACTS INPUTS TO PRODUCTION, INCLUDING EVALUATING OUTCOMES FROM CARBON PRICING MECHANISMS AND TRADING PROGRAMS.

THE PROPOSED RESEARCH RETROSPECTIVELY ESTIMATES HOW REDUCTIONS IN COAL-FIRED POWER-PLANT EMISSIONS OF PM 2.5 PRECURSORS IMPACTED LOCAL AIR QUALITY AND RELATED HEALTH OUTCOMES, FOCUSING ON BENEFITS PROJECTED UNDER THE CLEAN AIR INTERSTATE RULE AND THE TRANSPORT RULE. RESEARCH USES STATE-OF-THE-ART PARTICULATE TRAJECTORY MODELING, INTEGRATED WITH MORTALITY AND MORBIDITY HEALTH DATA AND LOCAL REGULATORY MANAGEMENT DECISIONS AFFECTED BY UPWIND EMISSION SOURCES TO EXAMINE POTENTIAL REGULATORY REBOUND EFFECTS.

THIS RESEARCH PROJECT PROPOSES TO MEASURE THE MONETARY BENEFITS TO PEOPLE OVER AGE 65 FROM THE 1997 REVISION TO THE NAAQS UNDER SECTIONS 108 AND 109 OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT TO ADD A NEW ANNUAL STANDARD FOR PM2.5 OF 15 UG/M3. THIS RETROSPECTIVE EVALUATION LEVERAGES NOVEL DATA AND CAUSAL INFERENCE METHODS TO DEVELOP NEW ESTIMATES FOR KEY METRICS USED TO PROSPECTIVELY EVALUATE BENEFITS OF PM2.5 REDUCTIONS UNDER THE CAA FOR REDUCTIONS IN ACTUAL PM2.5 EXPOSURE FROM 2000-2010.

THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ENHANCE TRIBAL PARTICIPATION IN E-ENTERPRISE.. THE CHEROKEE NATION, SPECIFICALLY THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM STAFF, WILL WORK TO PROMOTE DISCUSSION, COLLABORATION AND PARTNERSHIP AMONG TRIBES, STATES AND FEDERAL AGENCY REPRESENTATIVES ON THE E-ENTERPRISE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT PROGRAM, WHICH OVERSEES THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ABOUT 30 E-ENTERPRISE PROJECTS.  CHEROKEE NATION WILL ASSIST TRIBES IN PERFORMING CO-REGULATOR ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF TOOLS AND RESOURCES,  THAT WILL BENEFIT STATES, TRIBES, TERRITORIES, AND EPA AS OUTLINED THE SEPTEMBERS 28, 2016 GOVERANCE CHARTER FOR E-ENTEPRISE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT.
SMART GROWTH AMERICA WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMPETITIVELY SELECTED COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE US.  THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WILL FOCUS ON H
THROUGH THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT THE GRANT RECIPIENT WILL ORGANIZE AND PLAN THE NEW PARTNERS FOR SMART GROWTH CONFERENCE OVER A PERIOD OF FIVE YEAR
SMART GROWTH AMERICA WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WORKSHOPS TO GOVERNORS AND THEIR CABINETS AND STAFFS TO HELP THEM DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT POLICI
